member.name: M:ExceptionExtensions.RethrowWithNoStackTraceLoss(System.Exception)
member.summary: Rethrows an exception object without losing the existing stack trace information
member.param: The exception to re-throw.
member.remarks: For more information on this technique, see http://www.dotnetjunkies.com/WebLog/chris.taylor/archive/2004/03/03/8353.aspx. The remote_stack_trace string is here to support Mono.

member.name: M:ExceptionExtensions.Unwrap(System.Exception)
member.summary: Unwraps an exception to remove any wrappers, like .
member.param: The exception to unwrap.
member.returns: The unwrapped exception.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.DefaultTestCaseOrderer
member.summary: Default implementation of . Orders tests in an unpredictable but stable order, so that repeated test runs of the identical test assembly run tests in the same order.

member.summary: Gets an instance of the given type, casting it to , using the provided constructor arguments. There is a single instance of a given type that is cached and reused, so classes retrieved from this factory must be stateless and thread-safe.

The constructor arguments.
member.returns: The instance of the type.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.LambdaTestCase
member.summary: A simple implementation of wherein the running of the test case can be represented by an . Useful for emitting test cases which later evaluate to error messages (since throwing error messages during discovery is often the wrong thing to do). See for a use of this test case to emit an error message when a theory method is found that has no test data associated with it.

member.summary: Represents a test case which runs multiple tests for theory data, either because the data was not enumerable or because the data was not serializable.

The test assembly.
The type under test.
The method under test.
The theory attribute.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.MaxConcurrencyTaskScheduler
member.summary: This class limits concurrency for all Tasks that are started with this scheduler, and also uses the stopwatch from the dictionary based on the lookup key that is passed as the async state to the task during creation. CallContext data is used to flow the stopwatch lookup key throughout the process (when it's not present, it pulls the key from the Task's AsyncState).

member.name: M:Xunit.Sdk.MaxConcurrencyTaskScheduler.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The maximum number of tasks to run at any one time.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.TestClassException
member.summary: Represents an exception that happened during the process of a test class. This typically means there were problems identifying the correct test class constructor, or problems creating the fixture data for the test class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The exception message.
